data.text: Relating to or situated in the breast or chest.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a pectoral muscle; the pectoral cavity.

data.text: Useful in relieving disorders of the chest or respiratory tract.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Worn on the chest or breast.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Any of four muscles that occur in pairs on each side of the chest.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A medicine for relieving disorders of the chest or respiratory tract.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An ornament or decoration worn on the chest.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Figuratively, proceeding from the breast, as of the heart; from the inner consciousness.
Of, pertaining to, or connected with the breast or chest; thoracic: as, a pectoral muscle, vessel, nerve, etc.; a pectornl limb.
In entomology, pertaining to the pectus or lower surface of the thorax.
